image.altText: A small part of an old, rusting jetty

props.synopsis: A dive tour operator already grappling with the impact of the state's algal bloom says his business will not survive if the government does not repair the old Rapid Bay jetty and reopen the "world-class" dive site surrounding it.

title.children: Operator says business will go under if SA dive site doesn't reopen

image.altText: A older man in a suit holds up a graduation certificate inside a court room

props.synopsis: When Tim Looker retired, he was keen to pick up a hobby. So he returned to university, becoming a lawyer on his 74th birthday.

title.children: Tim returned to uni in his 70s and is now a lawyer

image.altText: A man with brown curly hair, wearing a red t-shirt and overshirt, singing at a microphone.

props.synopsis: Performing in front of more than 15,000 people, Leo Sayer played some of his most famous songs at the fifth annual Mundi Mundi Bash music festival in outback NSW.

title.children: At 77 years young, Leo Sayer says his best years are still ahead of him

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and glasses in a pink hoodie standing in front of a wall of sewing and crafting supplies.

props.synopsis: Domenica Tootell's sewing videos have racked up millions of views and thousands of followers. She is among a growing number of creators becoming entrepreneurs on social media.

title.children: Teacher turns sewing hobby into social media business

image.altText: Nestory Irankunda runs in celebration after a goal

props.synopsis: Nestory Irankunda pleads with his teammate to take a free kick before putting the ball into the corner of the net as Watford secures a 1-1 draw with Swansea City.

title.children: 'Look at my highlight reels': Irankunda opens English account with wondergoal

image.altText: close up of a truffle.

props.synopsis: Growers say the price of truffles is justified due to their rarity, especially as drought conditions this year have made them even harder to find.

title.children: Demand for truffles continues to climb despite $3,500 per kilo price tag

image.altText: Ken Hinkley at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Any coach embarking on a 13-year reign at an AFL club would probably accept 12 wooden spoons if they came with a single silver cup — but while that prize eluded Ken Hinkley's Port Adelaide, he is departing the Power with the blessing of the "footy gods".

title.children: Hinkley's time is up, but he's the 'proudest coach the world has seen'

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing sunglasses takes a selfie

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man has been sentenced to life imprisonment, with a non-parole period of 24 years, after he was found guilty of murdering his friend and housemate by setting him on fire in 2021.

title.children: Murderer jailed for at least 24 years after setting victim on fire

image.altText: An Adelaide Crows player jumps in the air with his knees and legs drawn up as he takes a mark.

props.synopsis: As AFL star Izak Rankine begins his four-game sanction for using a homophobic slur, LGBTQIA+ community groups and individuals say they are still dealing with fallout from the incident.

title.children: Izak Rankine 'not the victim' as Crows CEO considers more pride training

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A South Australian police officer accused of touching a woman's bottom has been cleared of indecent behaviour — but could have been found guilty of assault if it had been charged, a court has ruled.

title.children: Cop found not guilty of 'tickling' woman's bottom

image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The APY Lands board has been ordered to remove general manager Richard King after a review commissioned by the state government concluded his reappointment was "a failure of proper accountable administration".

title.children: APY general manager's reappointment 'constitutionally invalid', report alleges

image.altText: A lit up no vacancy sign, blue background and red letters, mountains are visible in the background.

props.synopsis: Queenstown's beauty attracts about 3 million overseas visitor nights each year, making tourism the backbone of the town's economy. But it has its consequences, and now locals are speaking out.

title.children: New Zealand town popular with Australians at 'cusp' of overtourism

image.altText: A sign outside an Aldi store

props.synopsis: Unions and some retail workers are calling on major retailers to back down on mandatory bag checks and security gates.

title.children: Staff safety concerns raised over supermarket bag checks, security gates

image.altText: A small coastal village, seen from the air, on a fine day.

props.synopsis: In some ways, this Welsh town is idyllic. But its 750 residents face an uncertain future and are even being branded the United Kingdom's first climate refugees.

title.children: Plans to surrender idyllic UK town to the sea

image.altText: A man and woman embrace while smiling

props.synopsis: As more people turn to ancestry websites and DNA testing, unearthing a family secret is no longer a rare experience. But experts warn that many people are unprepared for where their curiosity might lead them.

title.children: As DNA testing becomes the norm, experts warn it's a roll of the dice in a 'high-stakes' game

image.altText: Denise and Bruce Morcombe, sit together in their home on Queensland's Sunshine Coast

props.synopsis: The legislation — named after murdered teenager Daniel Morcombe — is set to be introduced to parliament this week and pass before the end of the year.

title.children: 'Daniel's Law' to establish new child sex offender registry

image.altText: Jes Star and her daughter Eden outside their tiny home.

props.synopsis: A Facebook post offering women $55,000 to build their first home looked like a scam. But 15 women took the chance to go from homeless to home owner.

title.children: These women built their first homes for under $120k. Here’s how they did it

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looks to the side while wearing a blue suit.

props.synopsis: The firing of the head of the US Defense Intelligency Agency (DIA) Lieutenant General Jeffery Kruse comes after the DIA produced a preliminary assessment that said US strikes on Iran set back Tehran's nuclear program by just a few months.

title.children: Hegseth fires intelligence boss after Trump angered by Iran strike damage report

image.altText: CARRA LUKE taigum

props.synopsis: Ms Luke, 48, was found with fatal stab wounds at her home in Taigum early Saturday morning.

title.children: Man charged with former partner Carra Luke's murder

image.altText: Dark clouds hover over Iluka breakwall on Beach Street at Iluka at new south wales.

props.synopsis: Police say it is unclear what caused the death of a woman whose body was found on Ten Mile Beach at Iluka.

title.children: Body of woman, 32, found on beach in far north NSW

image.altText: Central Law Courts close

props.synopsis: Attorney General Tony Buti said custody processes are being examined to identify how the man managed to walk from court on Friday.

title.children: Authorities allege escaped prisoner used false name to abscond from court

image.altText: A man with thick grey-white moustache, wearing dark glasses, khaki bucket hat

props.synopsis: Garrison St Clair was touted as an all-American rescuer sent to the Australian desert to find a missing adventurer. But soon after he entered the spotlight, his grand backstory began to unravel.

title.children: Garrison St Clair went to find Robert Bogucki in the desert — then his lies came unstuck

image.altText: several dogs sitting in the back of a mini bus.

props.synopsis: Sitting in their usual seats, the dogs' excitement is palpable as they head to a doggy daycare park where, amid the canine capers, they are changing the lives of people living with disability and loneliness.

title.children: Paws, play and TikTok fame, it's the happiest bus ride in Australia

image.altText: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un sits down with military officials in uniform standing next to him inside a room

props.synopsis: The North’s official Korean Central News Agency said the test proved the missiles effective in countering aerial threats such as drones and cruise missiles.

title.children: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un supervises test of new anti-aircraft missiles

image.altText: An aerial view of a car accident with a damaged car and a fire truck, and firefighters.

props.synopsis: Two drivers are killed at Toolern Vale when a vehicle observed by police officers to be speeding crashed head-on into another car.

title.children: Two dead after head-on collision involving allegedly stolen car

image.altText: A middle-aged woman speaks behind a lectern in front of a deep blue background.

props.synopsis: The changes are being announced just days after the government was urged to take action by the Economic Reform Roundtable.

title.children: Government to freeze construction code, fast-track housing approvals

image.altText: Serena Williams and Maria Sharapova side by side

props.synopsis: Maria Sharapova and the crowd are left stunned as her fiercest rival Serena Williams makes an appearance at her induction into the International Tennis Hall of Fame.

title.children: Williams praises Sharapova's 'excellence' in surprise hall of fame appearance

image.altText: A white man pours sand into the palm of an Aboriginal man.

props.synopsis: This photo was burned into Australia's memory, but the story behind the 50-year-old snap might shock you.

title.children: The untold history of one of Australia's most iconic photos

image.altText: a teenage white girl stares into the camera for a mug shot photo

props.synopsis: Kristin Brock and James Brock were found dead in their home in the US state of Georgia in February. Their teenage daughter is now charged with their killings.

title.children: US teen who begged TikTok for help after parents' deaths charged with murder

image.altText: Minjee Lee swings a golf club

props.synopsis: Australia's Minjee Lee continues her strong form with a pair of eagles in the third round of the Canadian Women's Open to share the lead with hometown hero Brooke Henderson.

title.children: Double eagles help Lee draw level with hometown hero at Canadian Open

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers won't be making big reforms to the tax system immediately. He knows major policy changes can have unintended consequences.

title.children: The 'golden era' of reform in the 1980s and 90s had a dark side

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: I see you're ready to be taken down a peg or two. I can sort that out.

title.children: So you think you're a Smarty Pants? Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: A woman in a white and pink costume performs air guitar on a stage.

props.synopsis: Aapo "The Angus" Rautio's high-energy routine secures Finland's first air guitar title since 2000 in front of a hometown crowd in Oulu.

title.children: Air guitar world title returns to Finland after 25 years

image.altText: The hand of woman wearing a grey long sleeve top rests on her patterned skirt

props.synopsis: One Far North Queensland sexual assault support service says it's helped 41 older women in the past three years.

title.children: Advocates call for focus on 'neglected' form of elder abuse

image.altText: A close up photo of a phone with dating apps like Tinder, Grindr and Bumble on the screen.

props.synopsis: Online dating offers a bigger pool of potential partners, but a new study shows it can lead to less passionate, satisfying and intimate relationships.

title.children: Online dating may not be the best way to meet a partner, study shows
